info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 7:15PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR REDUCED VISIBILITY AND SNOW- COVERED ROADWAYS THROUGH THE LATE EVENING HOURS... WEATHER... * Snow showers will continue to impact portions of Washtenaw, Wayne, Monroe and Lenawee counties through 9 PM. Activity will continue shifting southward and weakening with time from north to south. * Snowfall accumulations up to a half of an inch will be possible with hourly snowfall rates up to a quarter of an inch. * Visibility reductions below 1 mile at times will be possible over short distances. IMPACTS... * Hazardous travel conditions over short distances in snow showers due to rapid reductions in visibility and quick accumulating snowfall. Temperatures in the teens will make for quick snowfall accumulation on roadways and other paved surfaces. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the hazardous driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
